title: Daily Mass Readings for Wednesday, 23 September 2026
feast: Pio of Pietrelcina, Priest Obligatory Memorial

readings.heading: First Reading: Proverbs 30: 5-9
verses: 5 Every word of God is fire tried: he is a buckler to them that hope in him.
6 Add not any thing to his words, lest thou be reproved, and found a liar:
7 Two things I have asked of thee, deny them not to me before I die.
8 Remove far from me vanity, and lying words. Give me neither beggary, nor riches: give me only the necessaries of life:
9 Lest perhaps being filled, I should be tempted to deny, and say: Who is the Lord? or being compelled by poverty, I should steal, and forswear the name of my God.

readings.heading: Responsorial Psalm: Psalms 119: 29, 72, 89, 101, 104, 163
verses: R. (105) Your word, O Lord, is a lamp for my feet.
29 Remove from me the way of iniquity: and out of thy law have mercy on me.
R. Your word, O Lord, is a lamp for my feet.
72 The law of thy mouth is good to me, above thousands of gold and silver.
R. Your word, O Lord, is a lamp for my feet.
89 LAMED. For ever, O Lord, thy word standeth firm in heaven.
R. Your word, O Lord, is a lamp for my feet.
101 I have restrained my feet from every evil way: that I may keep thy words.
R. Your word, O Lord, is a lamp for my feet.
104 By thy commandments I have had understanding: therefore have I hated every way of iniquity.
R. Your word, O Lord, is a lamp for my feet.
163 I have hated and abhorred iniquity; but I have loved thy law.
R. Your word, O Lord, is a lamp for my feet.

readings.heading: Alleluia: Mark 1: 15
verses: R. Alleluia, alleluia.
15 The Kingdom of God is at hand; repent and believe in the Gospel.
R. Alleluia, alleluia.

readings.heading: Gospel: Luke 9: 1-6
verses: 1 Then calling together the twelve apostles, he gave them power and authority over all devils, and to cure diseases.
2 And he sent them to preach the kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.
3 And he said to them: Take nothing for your journey; neither staff, nor scrip, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats.
4 And whatsoever house you shall enter into, abide there, and depart not from thence.
5 And whosoever will not receive you, when ye go out of that city, shake off even the dust of your feet, for a testimony against them.
6 And going out, they went about through the towns, preaching the gospel, and healing everywhere.
